basic_data.cell_line_alt_name: CANVAS4-6 Het GC; C4-6 Het GC

publications.title: Generation and heterozygous repair of human iPSC lines from three individuals with cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS) carrying biallelic AAGGG expansions in RFC1

donor.disease_description: Patient with biallelic AAGGG repeat expansions in intron 2 of RFC1
donor.disease_name: Cerebellar ataxia, neuropathy, and vestibular areflexia syndrome (CANVAS)

genomic_modifications.description: Heterozygous gene correction deleting the pathogenic AAGGG repeat expansion in intron 2 of RFC1
genomic_modifications.genotype: Heterozygous gene-corrected: RFC1 intron 2 AAGGG expansion removed on one allele

genomic_characterisation.summary: SNP array analysis showed a normal male karyotype (46,XY) with no aneuploidies or large CNVs; identity to parental fibroblasts confirmed by SNPduo.

induced_derivation.non_int_vector_name: pEP4 E02S ET2K; pEP4 E02S EN2L; pEP4 E02S EM2K

ethics.institutional_HREC: Human Research Ethics Committee of the Royal Children's Hospital
